javadoc: DBHandle provides access to an open database.

methods.javadoc:
Construct a temporary database handle.
 The saveAs method must be used to save the database.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a temporary database handle.
 The saveAs method must be used to save the database.

Construct a temporary database handle.
 The saveAs method must be used to save the database.

methods.comment:
Construct a temporary database handle.
 The saveAs method must be used to save the database.

methods.javadoc:
Construct a temporary database handle.
 The saveAs method must be used to save the database.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a temporary database handle.
 The saveAs method must be used to save the database.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Open the database contained within the specified
 bufferFile.  The update mode is determined by the buffer file.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Open the database contained within the specified
 bufferFile.  The update mode is determined by the buffer file.

params.name: recover
params.comment: if true an attempt will be made to recover unsaved data if the file is open for update

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Open a specific buffer file containing a database
 for non-update use.  This method is provided primarily
 for testing.

methods.name: isConsistent
methods.comment: Check the consistency of this database.

return.comment: true if consistency check passed, else false

methods.name: rebuild
methods.comment:
Rebuild database tables to resolve certain consistency problems.  Use of this
 method does not recover lost data which may have occurred during original 
 database corruption.

return.comment: true if rebuild succeeded, else false

methods.javadoc:
Reset the database ID contained within the specified database file.
 This method is intended to be used when unpacking a packed database
 to ensure that a duplicate database ID does not exist within the project.
 WARNING! Use with extreme caution since this modifies
 the original file and could destroy data if used
 improperly.
@param file
@throws IOException
methods.name: resetDatabaseId
methods.comment:
Reset the database ID contained within the specified database file.
 This method is intended to be used when unpacking a packed database
 to ensure that a duplicate database ID does not exist within the project.
 WARNING! Use with extreme caution since this modifies
 the original file and could destroy data if used
 improperly.

methods.javadoc:
Read current databaseId
@throws IOException
methods.name: readDatabaseId
methods.comment: Read current databaseId

methods.javadoc: Returns unique database ID or 0 if this is an older read-only database.
methods.name: getDatabaseId
methods.comment: Returns unique database ID or 0 if this is an older read-only database.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the recovery changeSet data file for reading or null if one is not available.
 The caller must dispose of the returned file before peforming generating any new
 recovery snapshots.
@throws IOException
methods.name: getRecoveryChangeSetFile
methods.comment:
Returns the recovery changeSet data file for reading or null if one is not available.
 The caller must dispose of the returned file before peforming generating any new
 recovery snapshots.

methods.name: takeRecoverySnapshot
methods.comment: Request a recovery snapshot be taken of any unsaved changes;

params.name: changeSet
params.comment:
an optional database-backed change set which reflects changes 
 made since the last version.

return.comment: true if snapshot successful or not needed, false if an active transaction prevented snapshot

methods.javadoc:
Returns a shared temporary database handle.
 This temporary handle will remain open unitl either this 
 handle is closed or closeScratchPad is invoked.
@throws IOException
methods.name: getScratchPad
methods.comment:
Returns a shared temporary database handle.
 This temporary handle will remain open unitl either this 
 handle is closed or closeScratchPad is invoked.

methods.javadoc: Close the scratch-pad database handle if it open.
methods.name: closeScratchPad
methods.comment: Close the scratch-pad database handle if it open.

methods.javadoc:
Add Database listener
@param listener
methods.name: addListener
methods.comment: Add Database listener

methods.javadoc: @return the master database table
methods.name: getMasterTable

methods.javadoc: @return the buffer manager
methods.name: getBufferMgr

methods.javadoc:
Enable and start source file pre-cache if appropriate.
 WARNING! EXPERIMENTAL !!!
methods.name: enablePreCache
methods.comment:
Enable and start source file pre-cache if appropriate.
 WARNING! EXPERIMENTAL !!!

methods.javadoc: @return the database parameters
methods.name: getDBParms
checkTransaction
methods.comment: Verify that a valid transaction has been started.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if transaction is currently active
methods.name: isTransactionActive
methods.comment: Returns true if transaction is currently active

methods.javadoc:
Start a new transaction
@return transaction ID
methods.name: startTransaction
methods.comment: Start a new transaction

methods.name: endTransaction
methods.comment:
Terminate transaction.  If commit is false, Table instances may be added 
 or removed/invalidated.

params.name: commit
params.comment:
if true a new checkpoint will be established, if
 false all changes since the previous checkpoint will be discarded.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if there are uncommitted changes to the database.
@return true if there are uncommitted changes to the database.
methods.name: hasUncommittedChanges
methods.comment: Returns true if there are uncommitted changes to the database.

return.comment: true if there are uncommitted changes to the database.

methods.javadoc:
Determine if there are any changes which can be undone.
@return true if an undo can be performed.
methods.name: canUndo
methods.comment: Determine if there are any changes which can be undone.

return.comment: true if an undo can be performed.

methods.name: undo
methods.comment:
Undo changes made during the previous transaction checkpoint.
 All upper-levels must clear table-based cached data prior to 
 invoking this method.

return.comment: true if an undo was successful

methods.javadoc: Returns number of undo-able transactions
methods.name: getAvailableUndoCount
methods.comment: Returns number of undo-able transactions

methods.javadoc: Returns the number of redo-able transactions
methods.name: getAvailableRedoCount
methods.comment: Returns the number of redo-able transactions

methods.javadoc:
Determine if there are any changes which can be redone
@return true if a redo can be performed.
methods.name: canRedo
methods.comment: Determine if there are any changes which can be redone

return.comment: true if a redo can be performed.

methods.name: redo
methods.comment:
Redo previously undone transaction checkpoint.
 Moves forward by one checkpoint only.
 All upper-levels must clear table-based cached data prior to 
 invoking this method.

methods.javadoc:
Set the maximum number of undo transaction checkpoints maintained by the
 underlying buffer manager.
@param maxUndos maximum number of undo checkpoints.  An illegal 
 value restores the default value.
methods.name: setMaxUndos
methods.comment:
Set the maximum number of undo transaction checkpoints maintained by the
 underlying buffer manager.

params.name: maxUndos
params.comment:
maximum number of undo checkpoints.  An illegal 
 value restores the default value.

methods.javadoc:
Return the number of tables defined within the master table.
@return int number of tables.
methods.name: getTableCount
methods.comment: Return the number of tables defined within the master table.

methods.javadoc:
Close the database and dispose of the underlying buffer manager.
 Any existing recovery data will be discarded.
methods.name: close
methods.comment:
Close the database and dispose of the underlying buffer manager.
 Any existing recovery data will be discarded.

methods.javadoc:
Close the database and dispose of the underlying buffer manager.
@param keepRecoveryData
methods.name: close
methods.comment: Close the database and dispose of the underlying buffer manager.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if unsaved changes have been made.
methods.name: isChanged
methods.comment: Returns true if unsaved changes have been made.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this database handle has been closed.
methods.name: isClosed
methods.comment: Returns true if this database handle has been closed.

methods.name: save
methods.comment: Save this database to a new version.

params.name: comment
params.comment:
if version history is maintained, this comment will be 
 associated with the new version.

params.name: changeSet
params.comment:
an optional database-backed change set which reflects changes 
 made since the last version.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs.

methods.name: saveAs
methods.comment: Save the database to the specified buffer file.

params.name: associateWithNewFile
params.comment:
if true the outFile will be associated with this DBHandle as the 
 current source file, if false no change will be made to this DBHandle's state and the outFile
 will be written and set as read-only.  The caller is responsbile for disposing the outFile if 
 this parameter is false.

methods.name: saveAs
methods.comment:
Save the database to the specified buffer file and a newDatabaseId.
 Open handle will always be associated with the new file.
 NOTE: This method is intended for use in transforming one database to
 match another existing database.

params.name: newDatabaseId
params.comment:
database ID to be forced for new database or null to generate 
 new database ID

methods.name: saveAs
methods.comment: Save the database to the specified buffer file.

params.name: associateWithNewFile
params.comment:
if true the outFile will be associated with this DBHandle as the 
 current source file, if false no change will be made to this DBHandle's state and the outFile
 will be written and set as read-only.  The caller is responsbile for disposing the outFile if 
 this parameter is false.

methods.name: createBuffer
methods.comment:
Create a new buffer with the specified length.
 This method may only be invoked while a database transaction 
 is in progress. A database transaction must also be in progress
 when invoking the various put, delete and setSize methods on the returned buffer.

params.name: length
params.comment: the size of the buffer to create

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs while creating the buffer.

methods.name: createBuffer
methods.comment:
Create a new buffer that layers on top of another buffer.  This buffer
 will return values from the shadowBuffer unless they have been changed in this buffer.
 This method may only be invoked while a database transaction 
 is in progress. A database transaction must also be in progress
 when invoking the various put, delete and setSize methods on the returned buffer.

params.name: shadowBuffer
params.comment: the source of the byte values to use unless they have been changed.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs while creating the buffer.

methods.name: getBuffer
methods.comment:
Get an existing buffer.  This method should be used with care to avoid 
 providing an improper id.  A database transaction must be in progress
 when invoking the various put, delete and setSize methods on the returned buffer.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs while getting the buffer.

return.comment: Buffer the buffer associated with the given id.

methods.name: getBuffer
methods.comment:
Get an existing buffer that uses a shadowBuffer for byte values if they haven't been
 explicitly changed in this buffer.  This method should be used with care to avoid 
 providing an improper id.  A database transaction must be in progress
 when invoking the various put, delete and setSize methods on the returned buffer.

params.name: shadowBuffer
params.comment:
the buffer to use for byte values if they haven't been changed in 
 this buffer.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs while getting the buffer.

return.comment: Buffer the buffer associated with the given id.

methods.javadoc:
Determine if this database can be updated.
@return true if this database handle is intended for update
methods.name: canUpdate
methods.comment: Determine if this database can be updated.

return.comment: true if this database handle is intended for update

methods.javadoc:
Load existing tables from database.
@throws IOException thrown if IO error occurs.
methods.name: loadTables
methods.comment: Load existing tables from database.

methods.javadoc:
Reload tables from database following an undo or redo.
@throws IOException thrown if IO error occurs.
methods.name: reloadTables
methods.comment: Reload tables from database following an undo or redo.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the Table that was created with the given name or null if
 no such table exists.
methods.name: getTable
methods.comment:
Returns the Table that was created with the given name or null if
 no such table exists.

methods.javadoc:
Get all tables defined within the database.
@return Table[] tables
methods.name: getTables
methods.comment: Get all tables defined within the database.

methods.javadoc: Creates a new table with the given name, version and type.
methods.name: createTable
methods.comment: Creates a new table with the given name, version and type.

methods.javadoc:
Creates a new table with the given name, version and type.
 Create secondary indexes as specified by the array of column indexes.
methods.name: createTable
methods.comment:
Creates a new table with the given name, version and type.
 Create secondary indexes as specified by the array of column indexes.

methods.name: setTableName
deleteTable
methods.comment: Delete the specified table from the database.

throws.comment: if there is an I/O error or the table does not exist

methods.javadoc: @return number of buffer cache hits
methods.name: getCacheHits

methods.javadoc: @return number of buffer cache misses
methods.name: getCacheMisses

methods.javadoc: @return low water mark (minimum buffer pool size)
methods.name: getLowBufferCount

return.comment: low water mark (minimum buffer pool size)

methods.javadoc:
Returns size of buffers utilized within the underlying
 buffer file.  This may be larger than than the requested 
 buffer size.  This value may be used to instatiate a 
 new BufferFile which is compatible with this database
 when using the saveAs method.
methods.name: getBufferSize
methods.comment:
Returns size of buffers utilized within the underlying
 buffer file.  This may be larger than than the requested 
 buffer size.  This value may be used to instatiate a 
 new BufferFile which is compatible with this database
 when using the saveAs method.

name: DBHandle
comment: DBHandle provides access to an open database.
